TI FABRICATION OF TUNNEL-JUNCTIONS WITH YBCO INSULATOR YBCO LAYERED
   STRUCTURE USING (013)-ORIENTED FILMS AS BASE LAYER
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE TUNNEL JUNCTION; LAYERED STRUCTURE; (013)-ORIENTED Y-BA-CU-O FILM; GAP
   STRUCTURE
ID YBA2CU3O7-X THIN-FILMS; SINGLE-CRYSTALS; GROWTH; SPECTROSCOPY;
   ANISOTROPY; TC
AB Tunnel junctions with a Y-Ba-Cu-O (YBCO)/SrTiO3 (STO)/YBCO layered structure were fabricated using (013)-oriented YBCO ((013)YBCO) as a base layer, for the first time. We observed obvious gap structures at around 22 mV and around 10 mV, corresponding to twice the gap voltages parallel and perpendicular to CuO2 plane in the junctions, respectively. According to AFM images of the base (013)YBCO layer, the (013)YBCO surface was not atomically flat. These results suggest that the dominant structures of the (013)YBCO surface were formed not by (013)-planes, but by both (010)- and (001)-planes.
RP MATSUI, T (reprint author), FUJI ELECT CORP RES & DEV LTD,2-2-1 NAGASAKA,YOKOSUKA 24001,JAPAN, JAPAN.

TI WATER-ABSORPTION IN NOVOLAC EPOXY-RESINS STUDIED BY
   POSITRON-ANNIHILATION
SO JOURNAL DE PHYSIQUE IV
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP ON POSITRON AND POSITRONIUM CHEMISTRY ( PPC-4
   )
CY JUN 20-24, 1993
CL LEMONT ST ODILE, FRANCE
SP CNRS, DEPT CHEM
ID NUMERICAL LAPLACE INVERSION; INTEGRAL-EQUATIONS; LIFETIME DATA; PROGRAM;
   CONTIN
AB Water absorption rates of four kinds of epoxy resins cured with phenol novolac (PH) were compared with the results of positron annihilation lifetime measurements (PAL). Three samples: cresol novolac (CR), tetra-methyl-biphenol (TMB) and bis-phenol A (BA), showed almost similar absorption rates, while tris-hydroxy-phenyl-methane (THPM) absorbed water twice as fast as others. Since THPM has a larger tau3 value (hence larger intermolecular-space holes) than the other samples, the correlation between tau3 and the absorption rate seems evident. For THPM, the lifetime distribution was shifted toward a shorter lifetime after absorbing water, which is interpreted in terms of the particular structure of three-dimensional holes.
C1 SUMITOMO CHEM CO LTD,TSUKUBA RES LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 30032,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,NUCL SCI & TECHNOL RES CTR,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.

   GREGORY RB, 1991, NUCL INSTRUM METH A, V302, P496, DOI 10.1016/0168-9002(91)90367-Y

TI POSITRON IRRADIATION EFFECTS ON POLYPROPYLENE
SO JOURNAL DE PHYSIQUE IV
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP ON POSITRON AND POSITRONIUM CHEMISTRY ( PPC-4
   )
CY JUN 20-24, 1993
CL LEMONT ST ODILE, FRANCE
SP CNRS, DEPT CHEM
AB Positron irradiation effects on polypropylene (PP) and polyethylene during the positron lifetime measurements have been studied in detail. The effect, which was to decrease I3, has been found to be larger in air than in vacuum. For PP, when the lifetime measurements were performed at temperatures above 348K, the radiation effect was scarcely observable. However at low temperature the radiation effect was accumulated and I3 was decreased during the measurements. Irradiation of Co-60 gamma-ray up to the dose of 300 MRad also lead to similar decrease in I3, but the decrease due to gamma-irradiation was not as large as that due to the positron irradiation. Irradiation effect of positrons appears to be different from that of gamma-rays.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,NUCL SCI & TECHNOL RES CTR,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,CTR RADIAT CONTROL,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI THE EFFECTS OF THE GROWTH-PARAMETERS ON THE INITIAL-STAGE OF
   EPITAXIAL-GROWTH OF GAP ON SI BY METALORGANIC CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
ID GAAS; MOCVD
AB The effects of growth parameters (V/III ratio, growth pressure and substrate orientation) on the initial stage of the epitaxial growth of GaP on Si are described. It was found that a high V/III ratio is necessary to grow a smooth GaP layer on Si and that the V/III ratio where the growth mode changes from island-type to two-dimensional layer-type decreases with increasing growth pressure. A growth technique for obtaining a smooth GaP layer on Si and the nucleation mechanisms are made clear using these results.
C1 NAGOYA INST TECHNOL,DEPT ELECT & COMP ENGN,SHOWA KU,NAGOYA,AICHI 466,JAPAN.

TI ELECTRICAL-PROPERTIES OF GAP ON SI GROWN BY METALORGANIC
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
AB The technique for growing a GaP layer with both a smooth surface and a low carrier concentration is described. It is reported that a very high V/III ratio is necessary to grow a GaP layer on Si with a flat and smooth surface, but from the characteristics of GaP Schottky diodes, a low V/III ratio is necessary for growing a GaP with less defects. So the growth of GaP at low V/III ratio by using a GaP buffer layer grown at high V/III ratio is found to be a suitable technique to obtain device-quality GaP on Si.

TI NMR-STUDY OF CO-59 IN [CU/CO/CU/NIFE] SUPERLATTICES
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1ST INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON METALLIC MULTILAYERS ( MML 93 )
CY MAR 01-05, 1993
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN INST MET, RES INST PROD DEV
ID MULTILAYERS; MAGNETORESISTANCE
AB The interface structure of [Cu/Co/Cu/NiFe] superlattices, in which the giant magnetoresistance is induced by a small external field, has been investigated by Co-59 nuclear magnetic resonance in zero field. A very broad line ranging from 100 to 230 MHz was observed. The frequency dependence of the transverse relaxation time T2 and the enhancement factors eta is discussed.

TI EFFECTS OF THE STRANGENESS FORM-FACTOR OF THE NUCLEON AND THE CHARGE
   FORM-FACTOR OF THE NEUTRON ON THE ASYMMETRY OF PB-208(E)-],E)PB-208
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICS G-NUCLEAR AND PARTICLE PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID VIOLATING ELECTRON-SCATTERING; MAGNETIC-MOMENT; PROTON-SCATTERING;
   ISOSPIN
AB Effects of the strangeness vector current form factor of the nucleon (G(E)s) and the charge form factor of the neutron (G(E)n) on the asymmetry of Pb-208(e over arrow pointing right, e)Pb-208 are investigated. The effects of non-vanishing G(E)s (G(E)n) become important at q greater-than-or-equal-to 1.5 (2.5) fm-1. The asymmetry is found to be sensitive to the neutron and proton distributions in the nucleus. The measurement of the asymmetry at low q (less-than-or-equal-to 1 fm-1) can give us accurate information of the difference of the radii between neutron and proton distributions.

TI SERVICE CONTROL TECHNOLOGY FOR ADVANCED INTELLIGENT NETWORK - TO
   CONSTRUCT SERVICE INDEPENDENT PLATFORM FOR NSP AND SWITCHING SYSTEMS
SO NTT REVIEW
LA English
DT Article
AB Two steps are required to facilitate quick response to the wide range of customers' service needs and to enable the processing of such large-scale data as that involved in personal communications. TI METAL-INSULATOR-TRANSITION IN LA1-XSRXTIO3 AND Y1-XCAXTIO3 INVESTIGATED
   BY SPECIFIC-HEAT MEASUREMENTS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRONIC SPECIFIC-HEAT; HUBBARD-MODEL; MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; CAPACITY;
   PEROVSKITES; RESISTIVITY; TRANSPORT; SPECTRA; GAP
AB The carrier-doping (or band-filling) dependence of electronic states has been investigated in the perovskitelike titanate compounds, La1-xSrxTiO3 and Y1-xCaxTiO3, by measurements of the specific heat. The linear temperature coefficient of the electronic specific heat, gamma, is enhanced significantly near the metal-insulator phase-transition boundary, indicating a divergent increase of the effective electron mass due to the strong electronic correlation on approaching the metal-insulator transition boundary. The result is argued in comparison with that of the high-T(c) cuprates.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI BIOLOGICAL EFFECT OF 9-CIS-RETINOIC ACID AND 9,13-DI-CIS-RETINOIC ACID
   ON HUMAN ACUTE PROMYELOCYTIC LEUKEMIA-CELL LINE HL-60
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE JAPAN ACADEMY SERIES B-PHYSICAL AND BIOLOGICAL
   SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
DE VITAMIN-A; ALL-TRANS-RETINOIC ACID; 9-CIS-RETINOIC ACID;
   9,13-DI-CIS-RETINOIC ACID; VITAMIN D3; HL-60 CELL; DIFFERENTIATION
ID 9-CIS RETINOIC ACID; ALL-TRANS; DIFFERENTIATION; INDUCTION; RECEPTOR;
   CULTURE; RAR
AB 9-cis-Retinoic acid and 9,13-di-cis-retinoic acid were synthesized and their biological effects on human acute promyelocytic cell line HL-60 were analyzed. 9-cis-Retinoic acid was threefold more potent than all-trans-retinoic acid in assays to inhibit growth and to induce differentiation of HL-60 cells. The activity of 9,13-di-cis-retinoic acid was as high as that of all-trans-retinoic acid. Both 9-cis-retinoic acid and 9,13-di-cis-retinoic acid acted additively with all-trans-retinoic acid on HL-60 cells. Both 9-cis-retinoic acid and 9,13-di-cis-retinoic acid acted synergetically with 1alpha, 25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 to inhibit HL-60 cell proliferation. Thyroid hormone (T3) did not affect the action of the retinoids on HL-60 cells.
RP MURAYAMA, A (reprint author), TOKYO METROPOLITAN INST MED SCI,DEPT CLIN GENET,3-18-22 HONKOMAGOME,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF THE KONDO RESONANCE IN YBAL3
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID IMPURITY MODEL; PHOTOEMISSION; SPECTRA; CERIUM
AB We report the observation of a strong temperature dependence of the Kondo resonance in the valence-band photoemission spectrum and of the 3d --> 4f white line in the x-ray absorption spectrum of YbAl3. The asymmetric Kondo resonance has a binding energy of approximately 35 meV with a approximately 50 meV width. The temperature dependence of the Yb 4f spectral features and valence are well reproduced by Anderson impurity calculations with a Kondo temperature of T(K) almost-equal-to 400 K, demonstrating that both spectroscopic and near ground state properties can be described within a unified theoretical framework.
C1 AT&T BELL LABS,MURRAY HILL,NJ 07974.
   SEOUL NATL UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SEOUL 151742,SOUTH KOREA.

TI TOTAL SYNTHESIS OF CALICHEAMICIN-GAMMA-1(I) .1. SYNTHESIS OF THE
   OLIGOSACCHARIDE FRAGMENT
SO JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY
LA English
DT Article
ID POTENT ANTITUMOR ANTIBIOTICS; ENEDIYNE ANTICANCER ANTIBIOTICS;
   ESPERAMICIN-CALICHEMICIN CLASS; DNA-CLEAVING MOLECULES; DYNEMICIN-A
   MODELS; DIELS-ALDER ROUTE; TRIGGERING DEVICES; BICYCLIC CORE;
   CRYSTALLOGRAPHIC ANALYSIS; TRISULFIDE FUNCTIONALITY
AB The first total synthesis of the calicheamicin gamma1I oligosaccharide fragment in the form of its methyl glycoside (62) has been achieved. The synthetic challenge of the B-ring was recognized and studied initially, resulting in a novel and unique solution to the stereochemical problems posed involving a [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic thionoimidazolide (111). This chemistry was initially worked out on a model for the ABC-ring system (47) and then successfully applied to the real system. The success of this synthesis has enabled the completion of the first synthesis of the natural product itself, calicheamicin gamma1I (1), as will be described in the following papers in this issue.

ID POTENT ANTITUMOR ANTIBIOTICS; ENEDIYNE ANTICANCER ANTIBIOTICS;
   ESPERAMICIN-CALICHEMICIN CLASS; DNA-CLEAVING PROPERTIES; DYNEMICIN-A
   MODELS; DIELS-ALDER ROUTE; DESIGNED ENEDIYNES; TRIGGERING DEVICES;
   BICYCLIC CORE; CRYSTALLOGRAPHIC ANALYSIS
AB The first enantioselective total synthesis of (-)-calicheamicinone (3), the naturally occurring antipode of the calicheamicin aglycon, has been achieved. The key elements of the synthesis are as follows: (i) the use of an asymmetric allylboration reaction to introduce asymmetry into the molecule (13 + 17 --> 18), (ii) the incorporation of the nitrogen atom of the urethane through an intramolecular 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition reaction of an alkenyl nitrile oxide (22 --> 24), (iii) the apparently stereospecific introduction of the enediyne moiety through alkylation of ketone 34, (iv) an unusual one-pot double oxidation of hydroxy isoxazoline 39 to keto isoxazole 41, (v) the apparently stereospecific introduction of the alkylidene side chain through Wittig olefination of 41, (vi) the unveiling of key enamine-aldehyde functionalities through reductive ring opening of isoxazole 67, (vii) the bridging of the enediyne residue through intramolecular alkylation of an aldehyde (71 --> 72), and (viii) an unusual lactonization (72 --> 76) to correct an errant stereocenter.

TI SPLEEN-DERIVED GROWTH-FACTOR, SDGF-3, IS IDENTIFIED AS KERATINOCYTE
   GROWTH-FACTOR (KGF)
SO FEBS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SDGF-3; KERATINOCYTE GROWTH FACTOR; BOVINE SPLEEN; PRIMARY CULTURED
   HEPATOCYTE; HEPARIN BINDING
ID LIVER-REGENERATION; DNA-SYNTHESIS; PURIFICATION; HEPATOCYTES; REGULATOR;
   AUTOCRINE; CULTURES
AB A heparin-binding mitogen rat for rat hepatocytes was partially purified from bovine spleen by a combination of heparin-affinity, cation-exchange and gel-filtration chromatography. Besides stimulating rat hepatocytes, this factor, which was designated spleen-derived growth factor-3 (SDGF-3), exhibited mitogenic activity for mouse epidermal keratinocytes but not mouse fibroblasts. Its apparent epithelial specificity and heparin-binding properties corresponded to those of keratinocyte growth factor (KGF). These findings, together with the fact that the mitogenic activity of SDGF-3 was abolished by a neutralizing monoclonal antibody specific for KGF, identify this bovine spleen-derived hepatocyte mitogen as KGF.

AF TANIZAWA, Y

TI X-RAY PHOTOELECTRON-SPECTROSCOPY STUDY ON CHEMICAL-STATES OF FLUORIDE IN
   BOVINE DENTIN TREATED WITH NAF
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-FARADAY TRANSACTIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID F-19 MAS-NMR; CARBONATED APATITES; SYNTHETIC APATITES; CARIES
   PREVENTION; ROOT SURFACES; IONS; ENAMEL; HYDROXYAPATITE; DENTIFRICES;
   POPULATION
AB The reaction of bovine dentine as carbonate-hydroxyapatite (CHAP) with NaF has been investigated. XPS studies have shown that the dentine behaved similarly to the non-carbonated HAP as far as formation of fluoridated hydroxyapatite (FHAP) was concerned. However, CaF2 was also formed even in neutral conditions in contrast to the case of stoichiometric hydroxyapatite, and CaF2 was subsequently transformed partially into FHAP in phosphate buffer solution.

TI A TYPE-IIB MODEL FOR SUPERNOVA-1993J
SO NATURE
LA English
DT Article
ID HELIUM STAR MODELS; LIGHT CURVES; IB SUPERNOVAE; EXPLOSIONS
AB SPECTRAL, analyses of supernovae have allowed them to be broadly divided into two classes, type I and type II. Supernova 1993J was identified1-3 as a type II supernova following the detection of a weak hydrogen line in its early spectrum. But the optical light curve' of SN1993J is atypical for this class of supernova, with the intensity rising to a second maximum after the initial outburst. The light curve around the second maximum more closely resembles that of the type Ib supernova 1983N (ref. 5), the progenitor of which may have been a helium star6. Here we show that the secondary brightening and subsequent decay of the light curve can be explained by the radioactive decay of Co-56; combined with the early spectrum, this suggests that the progenitor may have been a red supergiant with an unusually thin hydrogen-rich envelope. If this model is correct, the spectrum will rapidly evolve from type II to type Ib, in which case SN1993J would be classified as a type IIb supernova7,8. We Suggest that the progenitor was in a binary system, and had lost most of its hydrogen envelope to the companion star before the explosion.

TI DISLOCATIONS AND TUNGSTEN CONCENTRATION PROFILES IN TUNGSTEN-SILICON
   CONTACT AREAS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE TUNGSTEN-SILICON CONTACT; DISLOCATION; DIFFUSION; TEM
AB Dislocation formation and impurity distributions in metal-silicon contact areas were investigated by means of cross-sectional transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images and energy-dispersive X-ray measurement. Dislocations were formed in the (111) plane in the [110] direction by annealing at 700-degrees-C when W was used as barrier metal. As the diameter of contact holes decreased, dislocations became more significant. Both W and As concentration profiles in the horizontal direction showed maxima at the edges of contact holes. The diffusion length of W in the edge areas was about twice that in the center according to depth profile. This implied that stress in edge areas increased the W diffusion coefficient by a factor of about four.

TI DEFORMATIONS OF POISSON ALGEBRA IN TERMS OF STAR PRODUCTS AND Q-DEFORMED
   MECHANICS
SO JOURNAL OF MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID DIFFERENTIAL-CALCULUS; QUANTUM GROUPS; EQUATION; GEOMETRY; SOQ(N); SPACE
AB Using star products, deformations of algebra of classical mechanics, i.e., Poisson algebra, are discussed in the framework of phase space, and algebras of q-deformed classical and quantum mechanics are obtained. In order to formulate q-deformed mechanics, enlarged phase space is introduced by attaching internal space on each point of classical phase space. The internal space is the origin of q deformations. Commutation relations between coordinate and momentum in q-deformed classical and quantum mechanics are derived and the q-deformed quantum mechanical free article is also discussed.

TI 1ST NMR OBSERVATION OF VALENCE FLUCTUATION IN RARE-EARTH COMPOUNDS-SE-77
   NMR-STUDIES OF TEMPERATURE-ACTIVATED VALENCE FLUCTUATION IN SM3SE4
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE VALENCE FLUCTUATION; LOW CARRIER-DENSITY SYSTEM; SM3SE4; NMR; NUCLEAR
   MAGNETIC RELAXATION
ID HEAVY; SYSTEM
AB We have performed Se-77 NMR studies on a semiconducting and valence-fluctuating compound Sm3Se4 and a reference system Sm2Se3 with particular emphasis on temperature-and frequency-dependences of the nuclear transverse (1/T2) as well as longitudinal (1/T1) relaxation rates. 1/T2 in Sm3Se4 shows a dramatic increase with decreasing temperature below 160 K, which occurs neither in 1/T1 of Sm3Se4 nor in 1/T2 congruent-to 1/T1 of Sm2Se3. Moreover, marked f2-variation with the resonance frequency f has been observed in 1/T2 of Sm3Se4 in this temperature range. Discussions are made on how Se-77 NMR can probe the valence-fluctuation (VF) phenomena, and the observed various features of Se-77 NMR are shown to be explained quite consistently in terms of the temperature-activated VF. As far as the present authors know, this is the first NMR observation of the VF in rare-earth compounds.

TI PHOTOEMISSION-STUDY OF CE2SB
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE CE2SB; CEBI0.9TE0.1; CESE; PHOTOEMISSION; HEAVY FERMION
ID CE-PNICTIDES; VALENCE; SURFACE; MODEL
AB Ultraviolet photoemission spectra have been measured for Ce2Sb, CeBi0.9Te0.1 and CeSe by use of synchrotron radiation to study their electronic structures especially to study the origin of the double peak structures. We have observed the same double peak structure in CeBi0.9Te0.1 as in CeBi. A remarkable triple peak structure is observed in CeSe attributed to the p, f and d bands respectively. Ce2Sb is more complicated but it was shown that the band structure is rather similar to CeSb except for a pseudo-gap between the p and d bands and that the f level is at the pseudo-gap causing no double peak structure.

TI YB-170 MOSSBAUER AND NEUTRON-DIFFRACTION INVESTIGATION OF THE
   ANTIFERROMAGNETIC PHASE IN THE KONDO LATTICES YBP AND YBN
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON COMPOUND YBP; YBAS; MONOPNICTIDES; MODEL; SPECTROSCOPY;
   EXCITATIONS; SYSTEMS; FIELDS
AB The Kondo lattices YbP and YbN (nonstoichiometric samples) have been investigated by Yb-170 Mossbauer spectroscopy, in the temperature range 0.085 K to 80 K in zero magnetic field in YbN and with an applied magnetic field at T = 0.045 K in YbP and YbN, and by neutron diffraction in YbN. In both compounds, the antiferromagnetic transition at T(N) congruent-to 0.7 K is first order and occurs through a progressive growth of paramagnetic domains as the temperature increases. The measured exchange interaction is much larger than k(B)T(N) in both compounds and it is found to be isotropic in YbP and anisotropic in YbN. The saturated magnetic moment in both compounds is reduced by 50% with respect to the value calculated from the crystal field and exchange interactions. These properties are interpreted in terms of the competition between the Kondo effect and the RKKY exchange interaction; using a model mean field NCA calculation to describe the magnetic phase, the Kondo temperatures T(K) are found to be near 5-10 K.
C1 PAUL SCHERRER INST,VILLIGEN,SWITZERLAND.
   SWISS FED INST TECHNOL,NEUTRON SCATTERING LAB,CH-8092 ZURICH,SWITZERLAND.
   TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI TRANSVERSE FORM-FACTORS OF SN-117
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW C
LA English
DT Article
ID 180-DEGREES ELECTRON-SCATTERING; OCCUPATION PROBABILITIES; PB-207;
   TL-205; BI-209
AB Transverse elastic and inelastic form factors for low-lying levels in Sn-117 have been measured by 180-degrees electron scattering in the momentum transfer range q(eff) = 1.1-2.4 fm-1. The simple independent-particle model fails to account for these data, predicting form factors that are much too large. In better quantitative agreement with the data are the results of more detailed calculations that allow for configuration mixing of valence nucleons, as well as first-order core polarization. As in the similar case of Tl-205, these calculations successfully predict the presence of a deep diffraction minimum observed in the intermediate q region of the elastic Ml form factor. Nevertheless, the overall description of the data by the detailed calculations remains quantitatively unsatisfactory. A more complete understanding of these data may rely upon the consideration of multiparticle-multihole configurations outside the 0HomegaBAR basis space.

TI STRONG ISOMER PRODUCTION IN FRAGMENTATION REACTIONS
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID INTRANUCLEAR CASCADE CALCULATION; MOMENTUM DISTRIBUTIONS; MODEL
   CALCULATIONS; FUSION
AB The population of the 0+ 0.228 MeV isomer of Al-26 has been measured in projectile fragmentation reactions at E/A = 65, 80, and 100 MeV. For beams of Al-27 and Si-28, the yield of the isomer was found to be approximately equal to that of the ground state, whereas for Ar-40 beams it was much weaker. The significance and utility of the surprisingly high isomer yields is discussed.

TI NOVEL LOGIC DEVICE USING COUPLED QUANTUM DOTS
SO ELECTRONICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SEMICONDUCTOR QUANTUM DOTS; LOGIC DEVICES; LOGIC GATES
AB A novel logic device using coupled quantum dots is proposed. The Letter shows that the (N)OR/(N)AND functions can be performed simultaneously by a single electron tunnelling between the quantum dots, if electron-electron interaction is taken into account. Data input and output are performed by irradiation and absorption of photons, respectively. The device size, the operation temperature and speed are briefly discussed.

TI SELECTIVE ANNEALING UTILIZING SINGLE-PULSE EXCIMER-LASER IRRADIATION FOR
   SHORT-CHANNEL METAL-OXIDE-SEMICONDUCTOR FIELD-EFFECT TRANSISTORS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE EXCIMER LASER ANNEALING; SINGLE-PULSE IRRADIATION; LOW ENERGY
   IMPLANTATION; SHALLOW JUNCTION; SHORT CHANNEL MOSFETS; DEFORMATION OF
   FINE PATTERNS
ID JUNCTION DEPTH; P+-N
AB Excimer laser annealing (ELA) for metal-oxide-semiconductor (MOS) devices of less than a quarter micron was investigated. A new structure for the electrodes and new processing were developed to prevent deformation of the finely patterned electrodes during ELA. For a wavelength of 308 nm of the excimer laser, SiO2 films of 100 nM were deposited on the electrodes to reflect the laser light effectively. Fine metal-oxide-semiconductor field-effect transistors (MOSFETs) with shallow junction depth of 50 nm and fine patterned gate of 0.3 mum were realized and their characteristics were evaluated.

TI PREPARATION AND CHARACTERIZATION OF SILICA-MODIFIED ACTIVATED
   CARBON-FIBERS
SO COLLOIDS AND SURFACES A-PHYSICOCHEMICAL AND ENGINEERING ASPECTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT RALPH K ILER MEMORIAL Symposium on the Colloid Chemistry of Silica, at
   the 200th National Meeting of the American-Chemical-Society
CY AUG 26-30, 1990
CL WASHINGTON, DC
SP AMER CHEM SOC, DIV COLLOIDS & SURFACE CHEM
DE ACTIVATED CARBON FIBER; ADSORPTION; AMMONIA ADSORPTION; MICROPORE; SIO2;
   SURFACE CHARACTERIZATION; SURFACE MODIFICATION; WATER ADSORPTION
ID MICROPOROUS CARBONS; SURFACE
AB Activated carbon fibers (ACFs) have relatively uniform slit-shaped micropores. A silica film was deposited on the micropore walls by adsorption of SiCl4 on the micropores, then successive reaction of adsorbed SiCl4 with H2O, and heat treatment using a greaseless vacuum line. The silica-modified ACFs were characterized by N2 adsorption, thermal analysis, X-ray diffraction, electron-probe microanalysis, scanning electron microscopy and diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy (DRIFT). No silica particles on the ACF surface were observed by the scanning electron microscope with a resolution of 10 nm. The modification of ACF by silica did not change the type of N2 adsorption isotherm; the silica-modified ACF was also microporous. The silica modification slightly decreased the micropore width by 0.2 nm from the t-plot analysis. The apparent surface area and micropore volume of the silica-modified ACF were more than 1100 m2 g-1 and 0.68 ml g-1, respectively. The silica-modified ACF can adsorb more than 400 mg g-1 of H2O at 303 K at a relative pressure of 0.7. The DRIFT spectra suggested that the silica film on the ACF is thin.

TI MICROPOROUS SILICA MICROBALLOONS
SO COLLOIDS AND SURFACES A-PHYSICOCHEMICAL AND ENGINEERING ASPECTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT RALPH K ILER MEMORIAL Symposium on the Colloid Chemistry of Silica, at
   the 200th National Meeting of the American-Chemical-Society
CY AUG 26-30, 1990
CL WASHINGTON, DC
SP AMER CHEM SOC, DIV COLLOIDS & SURFACE CHEM
DE ADSORPTION; MICROBALLOON; SILICA; SOLID SURFACE; WATER
ID CHEMISORPTION; ISOTHERMS; NITROGEN; SURFACES; FEOOH; WATER; SO2; NO
AB Silica microballoons about 1.5 mum in diameter were prepared from sodium silicate solution by the ultrasonic spraying dry and spray dry methods. Sodium ions were removed with 0.01 N HCl solution, using 1-3 l g-1. The prepared balloons were characterized with the aid of scanning electron microscopy (SEM), thermal analyses, electron probe X-ray microanalyses, Fourier transform-infrared, and nitrogen and water adsorptions. The SEM observation showed the formation of silica balloons about 1.5 mum in diameter whose shell thickness is about 0.1 mum. Thermogravimetry showed that microballoons prepared by these two methods have different types of silanol groups. The nitrogen adsorption isotherms were of Type II; the alpha(s) plots suggested the presence of micropores. The surface area of washed samples is greater than that of unwashed samples. However, the water adsorption isotherms of washed microballoons show a large uptake in the lower relative pressure region and were rather close to Type I. The surface area of washed samples from water adsorption measurements was much greater than that from nitrogen adsorption, indicating the presence of narrow micropores accessible only to water molecules.

AU SUZUKI, T
   SHIGEYAMA, T
   NOMOTO, K
AF SUZUKI, T
   SHIGEYAMA, T
   NOMOTO, K
TI X-RAY-EMISSION FROM THE COLLISION OF THE EJECTA WITH THE RING NEBULA
   AROUND SN-1987A
SO ASTRONOMY & ASTROPHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
DE SUPERNOVAE, INDIVIDUAL, SN-1987A; CIRCUMSTELLAR MATTER; HYDRODYNAMICS;
   INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM, SUPERNOVA REMNANTS; X-RAYS, STARS
ID LARGE MAGELLANIC CLOUD; SUPERNOVA 1987A; SN 1987A; PROGENITOR;
   EVOLUTION; SN1987A; LINES
AB To provide theoretical predictions for future X-ray observations of the remnant of SN 1987A, we perform two-dimensional axisymmetric hydrodynamical calculations of the collision between the ejecta of SN 1987A and its circumstellar nebula including the ring. The collision with the ring will start at 12-15 years after the supernova explosion. The intensity of the X-ray emission will increase as the mass of ring material grows which is heated by a shock wave arising from the collision. The X-ray flux is predicted to reach the observable level with the planned X-ray astronomical satellites. To diagnose the circumstellar structure around SN 1987A with future X-ray observations, we further study the dependence of the X-ray emission on the density, mass, and geometry of circumstellar matter including the comparison with the spherically symmetric model.

TI PHOTOCHEMICAL HOLE-BURNING OF TETRAPHENYLPORPHINE GLYCOSIDES
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB Glycosilated tetraphenylporphine (TPP) were studied by photochemical hole burning (PHB) spectroscopy. A lactosylated TPP / poly(vinyl alcohol) shows excellent thermal stability against cyclic annealing, suggesting that the interaction between the lactosylated TPP and the matrix suppresses irreversible structural relaxation by forming hydrogen bonds.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF A FOCUSING WIGGLER WITH TRAPEZOID-SHAPED
   PERMANENT-MAGNETS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 14TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON FREE ELECTRON LASER ( FEL 92 )
CY AUG 23-28, 1992
CL KOBE, JAPAN
SP SCI & TECHNOL AGCY, MINIST EDUC SCI & CULTURE JAPAN, MINIST INT TRADE & IND JAPAN, OSAKA PREFECTURE, HYOGO PREFECTURE, KOBE CITY, FDN OSAKA SCI & TECHNOL CTR, JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST, JAPAN SYNCHROTON RADIAT RES INST, NISHIHARIMA TECHNOPOLIS FDN
AB A focusing wiggler with trapezoid-shaped permanent magnets has been developed for the infrared free electron laser. A numerical trajectory analysis using a measured magnetic field shows that a betatron oscillation amplitude of the electron beam with 1pi mm mrad emittance can be restrained within 1 mm and the FEL's gain is higher than with the conventional wiggler. The magnetic field error can be easily reduced to 0.1% by precisely adjusting each magnet gap.

TI OPTICAL MEASUREMENT OF CRACK-PROPAGATION WITH HIGH-RESOLUTION
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article
ID DYNAMIC FRACTURE; INSTABILITY; WAVES
AB A new optical method is established to measure the crack length and its velocity in transparent crystals by utilizing the total reflection of light beam at the cleavage crack plane. The optical system is constructed by using a laser, a PIN photodiode sensor, and a wave memory. With the apparatus the crack propagation velocity can be measured at any desired position inside the specimen with a time resolution of less than 1 mus. The measurement on a cleavage crack in NaCl reveals that the maximum speed of the crack is about 800 m/s and the fluctuation of the velocity occurs prior to the arrest.

TI EXCHANGE CHARACTERISTICS OF CARBONATE-CONTAINING APATITE FOR AL3+, LA3+
   AND Y3+ IONS
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-FARADAY TRANSACTIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID INORGANIC CATION EXCHANGERS; SYNTHETIC HYDROXYAPATITES; PB2+
AB The exchange characteristics of synthetic carbonate-containing apatite for Al3+, La3+ and Y3+ ions in aqueous solutions have been investigated by a normal batch method at 25-degrees-C, and compared with those of hydroxyapatite. From the results, it was found that the exchange characteristics for Al3+ ions increased with CO32- ion content, and the uptake of Al3+ ions in aqueous solution with low initial concentrations was driven forward by the cation-exchange reaction between Ca2+ ions in the apatite sample and Al3+ ions in aqueous solution. On the other hand, the exchange characteristics of both the apatites for Al3+ ions were found to be reduced considerably in the system in which Al3+ and Pb2+ ions  coexist, In the reactions with La3+ and Y3+ ions, a significant difference between the removal characteristics of both apatites was not observed, and crystalline LaPO4 and y3+  ion-exchanged apatites were produced by the uptake of La3+ and Y3+ ions, respectively. These results should lead to important information for the clinical investigations of the roles played by the trivalent cations in inhibiting dental caries and for medical investigations of the behaviour of Al3+ ions in the human body.

TI RADIATION HARDNESS OF CERIUM-DOPED GADOLINIUM SILICATE GD2SIO5CE AGAINST
   HIGH-ENERGY PROTONS, FAST AND THERMAL-NEUTRONS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID INDUCED DISPLACEMENT DAMAGE; SCINTILLATORS; FLUORIDE; CRYSTALS; GSO
AB Degradation of Gd2SiO5:Ce in optical transmittance due to proton irradiation was negligibly small below 10(6) rad, smaller than 2%/cm at 10(7) rad and large at 108 rad. The radiation hardness of 10(7) rad against protons is by two orders of magnitude smaller than against low energy gamma-rays. Long term spontaneous recovery of the proton-induced damage is not large (10-20% of the initial degradation in 84 days). Recovery upon exposure to UV light occurs to some extent. Degradation due to thermal neutrons was negligibly small for a fluence of 10(14) n/cm2. No degradation was observed for exposure to fast neutrons of about 10(13) n/cm2 during one year in the extracted beam tunnel of proton synchrotron.
C1 SHONAN INST TECHNOL,DEPT MAT SCI & CERAM TECHNOL,FUJISAWA 251,JAPAN.

AU YAMAMOTO, Y
   SUZUKI, T
AF YAMAMOTO, Y
   SUZUKI, T
TI NMR-STUDY OF THE MOLECULAR AND ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE OF THE HEME CAVITY
   IN DOLABELLA MET-CYANO MYOGLOBIN
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE NMR; MYOGLOBIN; HYPERFINE SHIFT; NUCLEAR OVERHAUSER EFFECT; HEME; HEME
   ELECTRONIC STRUCTURE
ID NUCLEAR MAGNETIC-RESONANCE; CENTERED DIPOLAR FIELD; SPERM WHALE;
   GALEORHINUS-JAPONICUS; PARAMAGNETIC PROTEINS; HEMOGLOBIN-A; ACTIVE-SITE;
   H-1-NMR; RESOLUTION; POCKET
AB The molecular and electronic structure of the active site of the cyanide-ligated ferric complex of the myoglobin from the mollusc Dolabella auricularia has been investigated using NMR. Analysis of nuclear Overhauser effects has revealed that the correlation times for the internal motion of the heme propionate alpha-CH2 and beta-CH2 groups at ambient temperature are about 5 and 4 ns, respectively. These correlation times indicate that the terminal carboxylate groups of both the heme propionates are not bound to the protein via salt bridges. Although the absence of the propionate-protein interaction does not influence the equilibrium population of the two heme orientational isomers involving rotation about the alpha,gamma-meso axis, it allows the heme to rotate about the iron-His bond in the active site of the myoglobin. Such rotational motion of the heme resulted in an anomalous temperature-dependence of the heme methyl-proton hyperfine shift. Thus the present myoglobin studies provide the first example demonstrating the rotation of the heme about the iron-His bond in native myoglobin.
C1 KOCHI UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT BIOL,KOCHI 780,JAPAN.

TI DETERMINATION OF SODIUM BY SEQUENTIAL METAL VAPOR ELUTION ANALYSIS WITH
   HYDROGEN CARRIER GAS
SO JOURNAL OF ANALYTICAL ATOMIC SPECTROMETRY
LA English
DT Article
DE SEQUENTIAL METAL VAPOR ELUTION ANALYSIS; SODIUM DETERMINATION; STANDARD
   REFERENCE MATERIAL; SODIUM SEPARATION; ATOMIC ABSORPTION SPECTROMETRY
ID SEPARATIVE COLUMN ATOMIZER; ABSORPTION SPECTROMETRY
AB A method for the determination of sodium by sequential metal vapour elution analysis with hydrogen carrier gas combined with atomic absorption detection is described. The column is a molybdenum capillary tube (1.22 mm i.d.) and the temperatures are 1520-1870 K. Sodium vapour was separated from Al, Ca, Cu, Mo and Zn vapours. The system was applied to the determination of sodium in National Institute of Standards and Technology Standard Reference Materials and the accuracy (relative error) of the results obtained was within +/- 2%. Advantages of the system are direct separation of metals and the determination of sodium after wet digestion.

AU SAKAI, A

AF SAKAI, A
   MORI, N
   SHUTO, S
   SUZUKI, T
TI DEACYLATION REACYLATION CYCLE - A POSSIBLE ABSORPTION MECHANISM FOR THE
   NOVEL LYMPHOTROPIC ANTITUMOR AGENT DIPALMITOYLPHOSPHATIDYLFLUOROURIDINE
   IN RATS
SO JOURNAL OF PHARMACEUTICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID LIPOSOMES; CARRIERS; CANCER
AB Dipalmitoylphosphatidylfluorouridine (DPPF) is a potent antitumor agent that selectively gains access to the lymphatic system. To determine whether DPPF enters the lymph in an unmodified form, we administered DPPF orally to rats and analyzed lymph collected from a cannula in the thoracic duct. Although lymph was found to contain only very low levels of DPPF, two congeners of DPPF were detected at high levels. Instrumental analysis demonstrated that these congeners are 1-palmitoyl-2-arachidonoylphosphatidylfluorouridine (PAPF) and 1-palmitoyl-2-linoleoyl-phosphatidylfluorouridine (PLPF). PAPF and PLPF levels in thoracic lymph were shown to be approximately 30 times higher than those in plasma. These results suggest that DPPF is absorbed from the intestinal tract via the deacylation-reacylation cycle for the uptake of phospholipids and is selectively delivered to the lymphatic route after oral administration. DPPF is a candidate drug for the treatment of tumor metastasis, especially in cases where metastasis has occurred via the lymphatic route.

TI KINETIC-STUDIES OF THE REACTION OF
   1-DIALKYLAMINO-2,4-DINITRONAPHTHALENES WITH BUTYLAMINE IN
   DIMETHYL-SULFOXIDE
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-PERKIN TRANSACTIONS 2
LA English
DT Article
ID AROMATIC NUCLEOPHILIC-SUBSTITUTION; ANIONIC SIGMA-COMPLEXES;
   2,4-DINITRO-1-NAPHTHYL ETHYL ETHER; LIMITING PROTON-TRANSFER;
   STOPPED-FLOW KINETICS; MEISENHEIMER COMPLEXES; SECONDARY-AMINES;
   PIPERIDINE; DIMETHYLSULFOXIDE; PYRROLIDINE
AB The nucleophilic substitution reaction of butylamine with 1 -pyrrolidino-2,4-dinitronaphthalene (1 a) in dimethyl sulfoxide is subject to general base catalysis, whereas the reaction of the same amine with 1-piperidino- (1b) or 1-dimethylamino-2,4-dinitronaphthalene (1c) is not. General base catalysis is shown to be a consequence of rate-limiting deprotonation of the zwitterionic intermediate complex. The structures of la and lb analysed by X-ray crystallography fairly tie in with the great difference in behaviour between 1 a and 1 b.
C1 GUNMA UNIV,DEPT APPL CHEM,KIRYU,GUNMA 376,JAPAN.

TI DEHAAS-VANALPHEN STUDIES OF YBAS ABOVE AND BELOW NEEL TEMPERATURE

LA English
DT Article
DE DEHAAS-VANALPHEN EFFECT; HEAVY FERMION; YBAS
AB We have studied the Fermi surface and the cyclotron mass of a semimetallic heavy fermion compound YbAs both in the antiferromagnetic state and the paramagnetic state. We have found the Fermi surface of three ellipsoidal electron surfaces and one spherical hole surface, and that the shape of these Fermi surfaces is the same in both states. In addition, we have found that the temperature dependence of the dHvA oscillatory amplitudes change anomalously at the Neel temperature. This anomaly is ascribed to the change of the cyclotron mass and the Dingle temperature at the Neel temperature. To explain the large electronic specific heat coefficient, the extremely heavy hole surface with about 10(3) m0 should exist.

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT AND MAGNETIC-SUSCEPTIBILITY OF U1-XTHXNISN
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID TERNARY U-COMPOUNDS; ELECTRICAL-PROPERTIES; UNISN; SYSTEMS
AB The specific-heat C and magnetic susceptibility chi of U1-xThxNiSn were measured down to 1.5 K. Pure UNiSn (x = 0) shows an antiferromagnetic (AF) transition accompanied by a semiconductor-metal transition.  The magnetic entropy S(m) for UNiSn abruptly increases at T(N) suggesting a first-order phase transition. In addition to an enhancement of the density of states at the Fermi level associated with the metallic phase, the low-temperature specific heat suggests a magnon excitation in the AF state. In the paramagnetic state, the x-independent S(m) (T) and chi(m) (T) are explained by a model based on the localized 5f electrons in a crystalline electric field. Assuming the U4+ ion has a 5f2 configuration, we determined the energy scheme of U4+, where the ground state is a nonmagnetic GAMMA3 doublet. The first-order AF transition, reduction of the ordered moment, and enhancement of chi in the AF state are discussed.

TI SEARCH FOR A BOUND-STATE OF A NEGATIVE PION AND NEUTRONS IN O-18+BE
   COLLISIONS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW C
LA English
DT Article
ID MEV NUCLEON
AB A bound system of pi- and neutrons (pineuts) was searched for in the fragmentation region of O-18 + Be collisions at 100 A MeV. The upper limits for the production cross sections were obtained to be 0.08 and 0.20 nb at the 90% confidence level for singly charged systems pi-n2 and pi-n3, respectively.

TI NO 17 KEV NEUTRINO - ADMIXTURE LESS-THAN 0.073-PERCENT (95-PERCENT CL)
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON ANTI-NEUTRINO; BETA-DECAY; 17-KEV NEUTRINO; HEAVY NEUTRINOS;
   MASS HIERARCHY; SEARCH; SPECTRUM; S-35; EMISSION; LIMITS
AB To solve the controversial issue concerning the possible existence of a 17 keV neutrino with a 1% admixture in nuclear beta decay, we searched directly for any evidence of a production-threshold effect. The Ni-63 beta spectrum was measured with a magnetic spectrometer, with very high statistics along with a fine energy scan over a narrow energy region around the expected threshold. The obtained mixing strength was \U\2 = [-0.011 +/- 0.033(stat)+/-0.030(syst)]%, very consistent with zero, and decisively excluding the existence of a 17 keV neutrino admixing at the 1% level with the electron neutrino. The corresponding upper limit was set at \U\2<0.073% (95% C.L.). A new limit was also obtained for a wider mass range: \U\2 <0.15% (95% C.L.) for 10.5 to 25.0 keV neutrinos.

TI INTERPLAY BETWEEN LATTICE SOFTENING AND HIGH-T(C) SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN
   LA1.86SR0.14CUO4
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID STRUCTURAL PHASE-TRANSITIONS; HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTORS;
   ULTRASONIC-ATTENUATION; SINGLE-CRYSTALS; VORTEX LATTICE; LA2-XBAXCUO4;
   HEAT; INSTABILITIES; DISTORTIONS; LA2CUO4
AB High-resolution ultrasonic measurements have been performed on single-crystalline La1.86Sr0.14CuO4 in magnetic fields H up to 14 T. We found that by reducing temperature the transverse elastic constant (C-11 - C-12)/2 starts to soften from about 50 K and continues to soften down to T(c)(H), even when T(c)(H) is reduced to 14 K by magnetic field. The softening turns to rapid hardening by the emergence of superconductivity. This behavior of (C-11 - C-12)/2 is a consequence of the structural instability of the orthorhombic phase and disappearance of the instability caused by emergence of the superconducting state.
C1 YAMANASHI UNIV,INST INORGAN SYNTH,KOFU,YAMANASHI 400,JAPAN.

TI REACTION-KINETICS OF N2 ABSORPTION BY SM2FE17
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article
ID HYDROGEN ABSORPTION; SURFACE; LANI5
AB The kinetics of N2 absorption by Sm2Fe17 were investigated using volumetric and gravimetric measurements under ultrahigh vacuum and high N2 pressures. The kinetic results obtained suggest that the rate-controlling step in the N2 absorption by Sm2Fe17 changes from N2 dissociation on the alloy surface during the initial stage to N diffusion in the bulk as the reaction proceeds. The activation energy for the diffusion was found to be in the range 100-163 kJ (mol N2)-1.  Pretreatment of the alloy by H-2 gas decreases the initial rate, but increases the maximum amount of N absorbed in the equilibrium state.
C1 TOKAI UNIV,DEPT APPL PHYS,HIRATSUKA,KANAGAWA 25912,JAPAN.

AU SUZUKI, T
   IDO, H
AF SUZUKI, T
   IDO, H
TI MAGNETIC-NONMAGNETIC TRANSITION IN CRAS AND THE RELATED-COMPOUNDS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 37TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY DEC 01-04, 1992
CL HOUSTON, TX
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC
ID SYSTEM; MNAS
AB Crystallographic parameters of Cr1-xMxAs (M=Ti, Mn, Fe, Co, and Ni; x less-than-or-equal-to 0.1) and CrAs1-xXx (X=P and Sb; x less-than-or-equal-to 0.1) have been precisely determined as a function of temperature from 77 to 320 K. Discontinuous changes of lattice parameters have been observed at the Neel temperature. By this crystallographic method, the Neel temperatures T(N) of these systems have been determined. By analyzing the results, it has been found that the magnetic state of the compounds around CrAs is strongly controlled by orthorhombic B-axis length: (i) the compounds with B axis less than a critical length B(c) of 3.38 angstrom do not have magnetic ordering and are Pauli paramagnetic down to 0 K: (ii) the compounds with B axis greater-than-or-equal-to B(c) undergo a transition at T(N) from helical to Pauli paramagnetic states: (iii) the compounds of NiAs type with larger B axis (hexagonal a axis) show a Curie-Weiss paramagnetism at high temperatures.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), TOHOKU GAKUIN UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,TAGAJO,MIYAGI 985,JAPAN.
CR FELCHER GP, 1971, PHYS REV B, V9, P3046

TI MAGNETIZATION REVERSAL AND DEFECTS IN CO/PT MULTILAYERS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 37TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY DEC 01-04, 1992
CL HOUSTON, TX
ID FILMS
AB (Co 3 angstrom/Pt 10 angstrom) X N (N = 8, 16, and 30 bilayers) multilayer thin films were prepared by sputtering onto an 8 50-angstrom-thick SiN layer that had been deposited on a silicon (111) substrate. We used the polar Kerr effect to measure the time dependence of magnetization reversal over the temperature range 90-300 K. Direct domain observations were also carried out. The results show that the domain expansion process depends strongly on the number of bilayers. Uniform domain expansion was found only in the thinner samples. From the time dependence of the magnetization reversal measurements over the temperature range 90-300 K, the activation energy and volume associated with domain wall motion were found to be 1.2 eV and 2.3 X 10(-18) cm3 for N = 8 sample. The N = 16 and N = 30 samples seem to have a broad distribution of activation energies. Our observations suggest that both the coercivity and magnetization reversal are controlled by the defects that come from the interface between the Co and Pt.
C1 UNIV NEBRASKA,CTR MAT RES & ANAL,LINCOLN,NE 68588.
   IBM CORP,ALMADEN RES CTR,SAN JOSE,CA 95120.
RP SHEN, JX (reprint author), UNIV NEBRASKA,BEHLEN LAB PHYS,LINCOLN,NE 68588, USA.

TI UNIQUE ELECTRICAL AND MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF PYROLYZED
   POLY(HYDRAZOCARBONYL-1,4-PHENYLENECARBONYL) FILM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE GRAPHITE; ELECTRICAL CONDUCTIVITY; X-RAY DIFFRACTION; THERMOELECTRIC
   POWER; ELECTRON SPIN RESONANCE
ID DOPED POLYACENIC MATERIALS; GRAPHITE FIBERS; VINYLENE) FILMS;
   SPIN-RESONANCE; CONDUCTIVITY; PRISTINE
AB Graphitelike films with high conductivity exceeding 1.6 X 10(4) S/CM have been newly prepared by pyrolysis of poly(hydrazocarbonyl-1,4-phenylenecarbonyl) films (PHP) at 2800-degrees-C. Pyrolyzing processes have been examined by means of X-ray diffraction, thermoelectric power (TEP), and electron spin resonance (ESR) measurements. The rapid increase of conductivity similiar to that of soft carbon and the three-dimensional ordering of crystallites occurred in the heat treatment temperature (HTT) range of 1700-2000-degrees-C. The unusual ESR characteristics observed in the range of low HTT (less-than-or-equal-to 1000-degrees-C) may be caused by oxygen radicals evolving in the molecular structure of pyrolyzed PHP films.
C1 JAPAN HYDRAZINE CO INC,SAKAIDE RES CTR,SAKAIDE,KAGAWA 762,JAPAN.

TI MEASUREMENT OF ELASTIC-MODULI BY RECTANGULAR PARALLELEPIPED RESONANCE
   METHOD .2.
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE RECTANGULAR PARALLELEPIPED RESONANCE; ELASTIC MODULI; ORTHORHOMBIC
   SYMMETRY; CUBIC SYMMETRY; SHEAR MODULI
ID CONSTANTS
AB The rectangular parallelepiped resonance method can be a very powerful method if universal procedure to obtain elastic moduli from measured resonance frequencies is established. The procedure proposed in this paper has the possibility to determine all elastic moduli of crystals with symmetry down to orthorhombic symmetry. However, we have only confirmed that the method gives correct elastic moduli of specimen with cubic symmetry without previous information. Although we need a great many of measured resonance frequencies from the lowest frequency to very high frequencies to determine all independent elastic moduli of specimen having lower symmetry than cubic symmetry, we can determine the shear moduli (C44, C55, C66) from much fewer of measured resonance frequencies.
RP INOHARA, M (reprint author), UNIV TSUKUBA,INST APPL PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI ROLE OF HIGHER-ORDER ELASTIC-MODULI IN LARGE ELASTIC FINITE DEFORMATION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ELASTIC FINITE DEFORMATION; FREE ENERGY; HIGHER-ORDER ELASTIC MODULI;
   BAIN DEFORMATION; SHEAR DEFORMATION
ID CONSTANTS
AB It is proposed here that the change in free energy of crystals associated with large elastic finite deformation can be estimated using higher-order elastic moduli up to a limited order. Numerical estimation of the change in free energy is performed for two examples of finite elastic deformation, with use of the data for higher-order elastic moduli of beta-brass obtained by Swartz. One example is Bain deformation, which converts a bcc lattice into an fcc lattice or vice versa. The other is shear deformation along the (100) atomic plane.

AU TABATA, Y

TI SAFETY CONTROL OF INCENDIARY DISCHARGE OCCURRING FROM ACTIVE
   ELECTROSTATIC ELIMINATOR
SO JOURNAL OF ELECTROSTATICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON ELECTROSTATICS
CY MAY 11-13, 1993
CL LAHNSTEIN, GERMANY
SP DEUT GESELL CHEM APPARATEWESEN, CHEM TECH & BIOTECHNOL
AB An active electrostatic eliminator of corona type is useful to reduce electrostatic charges on non-conductive materials, but it rarely generates dangerous discharges including the incendiary one and causes various hazards in industry. Therefore, safety problems of the active eliminator have been often discussed in the case of using it in explosive atmosphere. The purpose of this study is to offer practical data for designing the eliminator of the explosion-protected type operating safely in explosive atmosphere. Experiments were made on incendiary discharges occurring from the active eliminator when it operated abnormally, and methods of controlling safely the incendiary discharge were investigated experimentally. It became clear that the incendiary discharge was able to be controlled by suppressing corona discharge currents and by absorbing instantaneously electrostatic energy stored on the eliminator when the active eliminator operated abnormally.    Results obtained from experiments are presented in this paper.
RP TABATA, Y (reprint author), MINIST LABOR,INST IND SAFETY,1-4-6 UMEZONO,KIYOSE,TOKYO 204,JAPAN.

TC 0

AU SATO, T
   SUZUKI, T
AF SATO, T
   SUZUKI, T
TI FORMATION CROSS-SECTION OF IRON-60 WITH REACTOR NEUTRONS IN
   FE-59(N,GAMMA)FE-60 REACTION
SO JOURNAL OF RADIOANALYTICAL AND NUCLEAR CHEMISTRY-ARTICLES
LA English
DT Article
AB Ingrowth of Co-60 radioactivity in an iron sample irradiated in a nuclear reactor has been measured for determination of formation cross section of Fe-60 in the Fe-60(n, gamma)Fe-60 reaction with reactor neutrons. After 5 years cooling, the irradiated iron was purified from Co-60 and other radioactive nuclides by an anion exchange separation method and isopropyl ether extraction in hydrochloric acid. The amount of Co-60 ingrowth was measured by gamma-spectrometry using a Ge-detector coupled to a multichannel pulse height analyzer 4 years after the purification of iron. Neutron flux of the irradiation position was calculated from the amount of Fe-55 produced. The observed value of 12.5 +/- 2.8 barn is slightly greater than reported value for burnup cross section of Fe-59(n, x)X, where x refers gamma, alpha, d, p and 2n, and X is any nuclide produced by the above reactions.
RP SATO, T (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,DEPT CHEM,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.

TI HEAVY-FERMION CHARACTER IN CE2SB AND CE2BI

   RESISTIVITY SPECIFIC HEAT
ID CERH3B2
AB Magnetic susceptibilities, electrical resistivities and specific heats of Ce2Sb, Ce2Bi and CeLaBi were measured to clarify these physical properties. The most characteristic points of these compounds are the following. Ce site are two dimensional and the distance between Ce atoms are very small. The similarity between these compounds and CeRh3B2, in which Ce sites are one dimensional and the distance between Ce atoms are very small, are discussed.

AU TAKATA, K
   SUZUKI, T
AF TAKATA, K
   SUZUKI, T
TI PERMEATION OF HYDROGEN IN VANADIUM .1. EXPERIMENTAL DETAILS
SO MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES
   MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
AB Experimental studies on the permeation of hydrogen in vanadium were carried out in the temperature range T = 300-500 K and pressure p = 66.5-2660 Pa. The inlet and outlet surfaces of the specimen for the permeation of hydrogen were cleaned by in situ argon ion sputtering every time before the permeation experiment. The flux of hydrogen was found to be proportional to p1/2 in the (p, T) range, where Sievert's law holds in the absorption experiment. However, the permeation rate at lower temperatures outside the above range was proportional to p3/2, which was taken to occur via the hyperstoichiometric beta phase V2Hx, where x > 1, formed in the subsurface layers. The temperature dependence of the permeability via the alpha phase formed in the subsurface layers was discussed in detail by taking account of the constriction effect of O-rings used for the support of the specimen. Finally, a discussion was given on the diffusion coefficients determined by the conventional time-lag method.
RP TAKATA, K (reprint author), SCI UNIV TOKYO,DEPT MAT SCI & TECHNOL,NODA,CHIBA 278,JAPAN.
CR ADAMS DL, 1981, SURF SCI, V107, P305, DOI 10.1016/0039-6028(81)90627-0

TI PERMEATION OF HYDROGEN IN VANADIUM .2. THEORETICAL DETAILS
SO MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES
   MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
AB In the present paper, a theory for the solubility of hydrogen in vanadium in equilibrium with the gas phase is worked out mainly for the beta phase, including the region of hyperstoichiometric concentration. Also, permeability of hydrogen in a bulk specimen of vanadium through the beta phase built into the subsurface layers of the specimen facing the gas phase is theoretically formulated. The results of the numerical evaluation of the solubility and permeability are satisfactorily compared with absorption and permeation experiments. The complementariness of these two experiments is to be noted, as discussed in the present theory.

TI RADIATION HARDNESS OF UNDOPED CSI CRYSTALS AGAINST HIGH-ENERGY PROTONS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID INDUCED DISPLACEMENT DAMAGE
AB We compared radiation damages of undoped CsI for 12 GeV protons and for Co-60 gamma-rays between 10(4)  and 10(8) rad. Degradation in optical transmission was similar in magnitude both for protons and gamma-rays; it is as small as 1-3% per 1 cm thickness at 10(4) rad, while it is as large as or larger than 5% above  10(5) rad. The above feature is different for BGO or GSO:Ce, whose radiation hardness is roughly two orders of magnitude smaller regarding protons than regarding gamma-rays. Recovery of damage is qualitatively similar both for proton and gamma-ray irradiations; spontaneous recovery is only partial and the annealing effect of UV exposure is negligibly small.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST NUCL STUDY,TANASHI,TOKYO 188,JAPAN.

TI REAL-TIME DISPLACEMENT MEASUREMENT USING SYNCHRONOUS DETECTION IN A
   SINUSOIDAL PHASE MODULATING INTERFEROMETER
SO OPTICAL ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE INTERFEROMETRY; LASER DIODES; SYNCHRONOUS DETECTION; FEEDBACK CONTROL;
   PHASE COMPENSATION
ID SURFACE PROFILE MEASUREMENT; LASER DIODE INTERFEROMETER;
   FEEDBACK-CONTROL SYSTEM
AB A real-time displacement measurement system using a sinusoidal phase modulating interferometer is proposed and demonstrated. The system utilizes the frequency components of the interference signal to detect the desired phase or the displacement in real time. The real-time phase detector is constructed with simple electronic circuits. The system also has a feedback loop to eliminate external disturbance. It is easy to measure the relatively large displacement that exceeds a half wavelength of the light because the compensation circuit is incorporated into the system to obtain continuous phase outside the region from 0 to 2pi.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), NIIGATA UNIV,FAC ENGN,8050 IKARASHI 2,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

AU SUZUKI, T
   KOIZUMI, H
AF SUZUKI, T
   KOIZUMI, H
TI INERTIAL MOTION AND MULTI-KINK PAIR FORMATION OF DISLOCATIONS ON THE
   PEIERLS POTENTIAL
SO PHILOSOPHICAL MAGAZINE A-PHYSICS OF CONDENSED MATTER STRUCTURE DEFECTS
   AND MECHANICAL PROPERTIES
LA English
DT Article
ID PLASTICITY
AB The motion of a dislocation overcoming the Peierls potential is investigated by integrating the equation of motion. The behaviour of the segment following the nucleation of the first pair of kinks changes drastically from overdamping to underdamping at a critical value of the applied stress tau. When tau is smaller than a critical value tau*, the migration of kinks is dominant and the whole segment falls into the next valley of the Peierls relief to complete single kink pair formation. On the contrary, when tau > tau*, due to inertia the centre part of the bowed out segment overcomes the second maximum of the Peierls relief, and continues to overcome the succeeding maxima dynamically, resulting in multi-kink pair formation. The critical stress tau* is about 0.7tau(P) in the absence of friction, tau(p) being the Peierls stress. It increases with increasing friction. The possibility to observe the multi-kink pair formation is discussed for f.c.c. metals, b.c.c. metals and ionic crystals.
C1 MEIJI UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TAMA KU,KAWASAKI 214,JAPAN.

AF KASUYA, T

   KWON, YS
   SUZUKI, T
TI PHYSICS IN LOW CARRIER STRONG CORRELATION SYSTEMS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID ANOMALOUS MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; RARE-EARTH PNICTIDES; CE MONOPNICTIDES;
   STATES
AB As the most typical example of low carrier heavy fermion kondo systems, various anomalous properties in the rare earth monopnictides, RX, in particular La, Ce and Yb compounds, were critically reviewed. It was shown that even in the LaX electron-hole pair, strong correlation leading to the Wigner crystallization is important to understand various anomalies in LaSb. In CeX, the above characteristic naturally induces magnetic polaron crystallization including the AFP and FP phases well known in CeSb. In some circumstances, an electron-hole pair is trapped at each magnetic polaron causing the metal-insulator like transition seen in CeSb under high pressure.
C1 SUNGKYUNKWAN UNIV, DEPT PHYS, SUWON, SOUTH KOREA.

ID VALENCE
AB Sm3Se4 is a heavy fermion system with extremely low carriers at low temperatures and known to show a valence fluctuation due to thermal hopping at room temperature. TI RESONANT PHOTOELECTRON-SPECTRA OF GD COMPOUNDS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID EARTH
AB 4f resonant photoelectron spectra of three kinds of Gd compounds, GdB6, GdB4 and Gd2S3, have been measured in the excitation photon energy from 32 to 154 eV. The line shapes of the 4f state of these materials are different from one another. The origin of the difference is discussed.

TI FERMI-SURFACE AND CYCLOTRON MASS ABOVE AND BELOW THE NEEL TEMPERATURE IN
   SMSB
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The Fermi surface and the cyclotron mass both above and below the Neel temperature were determined by the dHvA effect. We have found the Fermi surface of three ellipsoidal electron surfaces, and spherical and nearly octahedral hole surfaces. In addition, we have found an anomalous temperature dependence on the oscillatory amplitude.

TI FERMI-SURFACE AND CYCLOTRON MASS OF EXTREMELY LOW CARRIER SYSTEM CEAS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The Fermi surface and the cyclotron mass of a semimetallic compound, CeAs, were determined by use of the dHvA effect. TI FERMI-SURFACE OF CEAS IN VERY HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The Shubnikov-de Haas (SdH) effect of a CeAs crystal was studied in high magnetic fields up to 260 kOe. Drastic changes in both oscillatory amplitude and frequency were observed around 140 kOe where an antiferro- to ferromagnetic phase transition occurs, suggesting the structural change of the Fermi surface.

TI ACOUSTIC DE-HAAS-VAN-ALPHEN EFFECT IN LASB AND CESB
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID ANOMALOUS MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; FERMI-SURFACE; MONOPNICTIDES; STATE
AB We have investigated the de Haas-van Alphen effect in LaSb and CeSb by means of an ultrasound velocity measurement. Anisotropic electron-strain interactions on the Fermi surfaces in LaSb were found by the field angle dependence of the oscillatory intensity of the longitudinal C-11 mode. The large and heavy hole beta4, which was predicted by the p-f mixing model, has been found in CeSb. The cyclotron effective mass of beta4, was 4.2m0.

TI DE-HAAS-VAN-ALPHEN EFFECT AND ANISOTROPIC MAGNETIZATION OF SINGLET
   GROUND-STATE PRSB IN HIGH MAGNETIC-FIELD
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB De Haas-van Alphen effect and high-field magnetization were measured in PrSb single crystals up to 250 kOe. The magnetic field dependence of the Fermi surface was found by a spectral analysis based on the maximum-entropy method. An anisotropic and nonlinear magnetization was well reproduced by the crystal-field-only model.

TI ENERGY-GAP STATE OF GD2S3
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The reflectivity spectrum of Gd2S3 has been measured in the energy region from 2 meV to 30 eV at 300, 77, 20 and 9 K. At low temperatures it was found that an energy gap state on the Fermi level appeared at 7 meV. The origin of this gap is discussed.

TI PRESSURE-DEPENDENCE OF THE CRYSTAL-FIELD STATE OF A LOW CARRIER SYSTEM
   CEP
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Pressure dependence of the crystal field splitting in CeP has been studied by inelastic neutron scattering up to 0.8 GPa. It was found that the GAMMA7-GAMMA8 crystal field splitting in CeP decreases by about 10% from that at ambient pressure by applying a pressure of 0.8 GPa at temperatures below 60 K. Evidence for the temperature dependence of the pressure effect is seen.
C1 UNIV TOKYO, INST SOLID STATE PHYS, TOKYO 106, JAPAN.
   NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS, TSUKUBA, IBARAKI 305, JAPAN.

TI MULTISTEP MAGNETIZATION INDUCED BY THE LANDAU-LEVEL CROSSING IN CEP
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB High field magnetization of CeP is investigated up to 64 T. Successive multistep magnetization associated with the Landau level crossing is found. The phenomenon is explained by the model that the spin-population change in the hole carriers at the crossing fields induce stepwise changes in the Ce spin magnetization.

TI ENERGY-GAP SUPPRESSION BY ALLOYING IN CENI1-XPTXSN
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE-FLUCTUATING COMPOUND; CENISN
AB The specific heat C of CeNi1-xPtxSn has been measured at temperatures T between 1.3 and 60 K. With increasing Pt concentration x from 0 to 0.2, the ratio C/T at 1.5K recovers from a reduced value of 0.10J/K2 mol due to the gapping (x = 0) to an enhanced value of 0.34 J/K2 Mol (x = 0.2). This gap suppression is discussed in terms of reduction of the c-f hybridization and destruction of coherence.

TI NMR AND MU-SR STUDIES OF VALENCE FLUCTUATION AND MAGNETISM IN SM3SE4
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Temperature-activated valence fluctuation has been concluded in a semiconducting compound Sm3Se4 from detailed temperature- and frequency-dependencies of the nuclear relaxation rates of Se-77 NMR above about 130 K. Exploiting the different time-window of the mu+SR technique, the valence fluctuation in the lower-temperature range and the ground-state magnetic properties have also been investigated.

TI NMR INVESTIGATIONS OF THE GROUND-STATE IN THE GAP-TYPE KONDO-LATTICE
   COMPOUND CENISN AND THE LOW-CARRIER SYSTEM YB4AS3
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE
AB The low-temperature magnetic proper-ties of the gap-type (semiconducting) Kondo lattice compound CeNiSn and the low-carrier system (semimetallic) Yb4As3 have been investigated by means of Sn-119 NMR and As-75 NQR techniques, respectively. NMR and NOR studies have shown that the magnetic correlation develops below around 0.13 and 10 K for CeNiSn and Yb4As3, respectively. In CeNiSn, alloying depresses the V-shaped pseudogap, while it stabilizes the magnetic correlation toward a static magnetic ordering. In Yb4As3, a spatial distribution of the magnetic correlation emerges, but the magnetic ordered state has not yet been identified down to 0.45 K.
C1 HIROSHIMA UNIV, FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI, HIROSHIMA 730, JAPAN.

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT MEASUREMENTS OF YB4AS3 - A HEAVY-FERMION SYSTEM WITH LOW
   CARRIER CONCENTRATION
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID STATES; YB4SB3
AB The specific heat of Yb4As3, a mixed-valence system, has been measured down to 100 mK in magnetic fields up to 4 T. At low temperature a nuclear contribution in the specific heat is seen. The Sommerfeld coefficient gamma is approximately 150 mj/K2 mole at zero field. The magnetic field opens up a gap at low temperatures.

TI CHARGE-ORDERING IN SM4BI3 AND YB4AS3 WITH THE ANTI-TH3P4 STRUCTURE
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID SYSTEM YB4AS3
AB Sm4Bi3 and Yb4As3 are mixed valence materials with the ratio of 1:3 of trivalent and divalent rare earth ions and are expected to show charge-ordering. In the specific heat of Sm4Bi3 and Yb4As3 we observed very sharp peaks at 260 K and at 293 K, respectively. Entropies estimated from these peaks are too small to be ascribed to full ordering, suggesting short range ordering at higher temperatures.

TI WHY THE MAGNETIC AND ELECTRICAL-PROPERTIES OF CE MONOPNICTIDES ARE SO
   SENSITIVE TO PRESSURE
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID CERIUM
AB The effects of pressure on the electrical and magnetic properties of CeX (X = P, As, Sb and Bi) have been investigated and are reviewed, illustrating how the high pressure technique can be used to gain information about the electronic and magnetic state of these compounds. Most recently, a comprehensive pressure-temperature phase diagram has been established for CeP. The overall features of the highly unusual behavior revealed in these compounds can be understood qualitatively on the basis of this phase diagram. However, some phenomena, such as a huge enhancement of the resistivity induced by applying pressure in CeSb, still remain unexplained.

TI SPIN DYNAMICS OF YBX (X = N, P, AS)
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID MONOPNICTIDES
AB The neutron quasi-elastic scattering (QES) spectra for YbX (X = N, P, As) show a quite common feature independent of X. The Kondo effect almost completely suppresses the magnetic ordering, which indicates that T(K) is comparable to T(RKKY) of about 20 K. The crossover of QES spectra from a Gaussian-like to a Lorentzian-like form occurs with the increase of temperature.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV, DEPT PHYS, SENDAI, MIYAGI 980, JAPAN.
RP OHOYAMA, K (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV, INST MAT RES, 2-1-1 KATAHIRA, AOBA KU, SENDAI, MIYAGI 980, JAPAN.

TI HEAVY-FERMION CHARACTERISTICS IN AMORPHOUS AND CRYSTALLIZED CE66SI34
   ALLOYS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; SYSTEM
AB A comparative study has been performed for amorphous and crystallized Ce66Si34 alloys. These alloys exhibit marked enhancement in the electronic specific-heat coefficient, but the formation of the Kondo lattice and antiferromagnetic ordering are suppressed by random atom stacking in the amorphous phase.

TI NEUTRON-SCATTERING INVESTIGATIONS OF MAGNETIC-ORDERING AND CRYSTAL-FIELD
   EXCITATIONS IN CEAS UNDER HIGH-PRESSURE
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Elastic neutron scattering experiments on CeAs have been performed under high pressure. A new magnetic ordering with a ferromagnetic component is induced above approximately 1.1 GPa, and a magnetic P-T phase diagram up to 3 GPa is determined. A qualitative aspect for the relation between the pressure-induced new magnetic phase and the crystal field splitting is discussed.

TI MAGNETIC-FIELD-INDUCED PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN THE CERIUM MONOCHALCOGENIDES
   CES AND CESE
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Magnetic phase diagrams of CeS and CeSe have been studied by neutron scattering, magnetoresistance and magnetization experiments. Along the easy axis [110] the magnetization curve of CeS at 4.2 K shows two steps at 5.6 and 9 T. In CeSe at 1.7 K a first-order phase transition occurs at 5.7 T in fields along [110] and [111].

TI PRESSURE-INDUCED ELECTRONIC PHASE-TRANSITION IN CEP - DENSE KONDO STATE
   TO NORMAL METALLIC STATE
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID ANOMALOUS MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; MONOPNICTIDES
AB The electrical resistivity of single-crystalline CeP has been measured under high pressure up to 8 GPa. At Pressures Of more than 5.0 GPa, a remarkable change is observed in the resistivity versus temperature curve, rho(T), suggesting the possibility of an electronic phase transition from the magnetic dense Kondo state to a nonmagnetic normal metallic state.

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT OF YTTERBIUM MONOPNICTIDES UNDER MAGNETIC-FIELDS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The specific heat of the ytterbium monopnictides YbX (X = N, P, As, Sb) measured in magnetic fields up to 10 T shows a different field dependence of the broad peak around 5 K in the four compounds. The zero-field data are analyzed with a new model including both Kondo effect and magnetic excitations.

TI ANTIFERROMAGNETISM AND CRYSTALLINE ELECTRIC-FIELD IN STOICHIOMETRIC YBP
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID NEUTRON
AB Neutron diffraction investigations of stoichiometric YbP prove the existence of long-range antiferromagnetic ordering of type II with an ordered magnetic moment mu(Yb) = 0.89(6)mu(B) and a Neel temperature T(N) = 0.66(1) K. The crystal field level scheme was established by neutron spectroscoPY to be GAMMA6-GAMMA8 (19 meV)-GAMMA7 (43.3 meV).

TI ANOMALY IN THE SPECIFIC-HEAT OF THE NEW MATERIAL YB3S4
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB We have measured the magnetic susceptibility and specific heats under several magnetic fields for Yb3S4. Its resistivity measurement using a DC method, however, failed since its conductivity is zero. From the inverse magnetic susceptibility the ratio of Yb3+ and Yb2+ ions per formula unit is estimated to be 4:1 and theta(p) congruent-to -62 K. A broad peak suggesting the Kondo peak appears in the specific heat. The peak shifts to higher temperature and becomes broader with increasing magnetic field.
C1 CEN, DRF, SBT LCP & SPH MDN, F-38041 GRENOBLE, FRANCE.

TI NUCLEAR MAGNETIC-RELAXATION IN A HEAVY-FERMION COMPOUND YBAS
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID MONOPNICTIDES
AB The As-75 nuclear spin-lattice relaxation rate (T1(-1)) of a heavy-fermion compound YbAs has been measured between 0.52 K and 100 K. The relaxation process seems to consist of two components, although As atoms have cubic local symmetry and have no quadrupolar field. The relaxation rate for the shorter T1 decreases gradually below 1.5 K with decreasing temperature. This behavior is quite in contrast to that of YbP, which has a sudden increase at T(N). This difference seems to be consistent with the difference in the temperature dependence of the order parameter between YbAs and YbP.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV, FAC SCI, DEPT PHYS, SENDAI, MIYAGI 980, JAPAN.
RP OYAMADA, A (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV, COLL LIBERAL ARTS & SCI, DEPT PHYS, KYOTO 606, JAPAN.

TI LOW-TEMPERATURE MAGNETORESISTANCE AND MAGNETIC PHASE-DIAGRAM OF THE
   INTERMETALLIC ACTINIDE COMPOUND NPPT3
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The magnetoresistance of the intermetallic actinide compound NpPt3 is reported in the temperature region where this material orders antiferromagnetically (T(N) almost-equal-to 29 K). A magnetic phase diagram is proposed from different features in the temperature and magnetic field dependences for two kinds of geometries.

TI DHVA MEASUREMENT IN A SEMIMETALLIC COMPOUND U3P4
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID U3AS4
AB We report de Haas-van Alphen (dHvA) measurements with a He-3-He-4 dilution refrigerator in U3P4. The uranium compound U3P4 crystallizes in the BCC Th3P4-type structure with a space group T6d (143dBAR). This compound is ferromagnetic below 137 K with a complex triaxial magnetic structure. Our measurements reveal new sheets of the Fermi surface which have heavy cyclotron effective masses and suggest open orbits in the (111) plane. We have clarified that the Fermi surfaces of U3P4 are not so simple as those expected before.
RP INADA, Y (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV, FAC SCI, DEPT PHYS, SENDAI, MIYAGI 980, JAPAN.

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT AND MAGNETOCALORIC EFFECT IN UNIGA
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB Temperature dependence of the specific heat was measured on a single crystal of UNiGa in magnetic fields. The value gamma = 40.9mJ/mol K2 does not change with the field-induced transition. The magnetic entropy is larger in the high-field (ferromagnetic) state (0.55 x R ln2) than in the AF ground state (0.50 x R ln2). Thermodynamic analysis shows that the high-field state is a true ferromagnetic state.
C1 UNIV AMSTERDAM, VAN DER WAALS ZEEMAN LAB, 1012 WX AMSTERDAM, NETHERLANDS.

TI HEAT-CAPACITY AND NMR-STUDIES ON ELECTRON CORRELATIONS IN CA1-XYXVO3 AND
   SR1-XLAXTIO3
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
AB The carrier doping dependence of electronic structure is investigated by means of heat capacity and V NMR measurements in titanium and vanadium oxide compounds. The effective electron masses are enhanced near the metal-insulator transition boundary in Ca1-xYxVO3 and Sr1-xLaxTiO3, indicating a significant increase in electron correlations with carrier filling. The hyperfine field of V-51 is found to be 246kOe in the magnetically ordered state of YVO3. The nuclear spin-lattice relaxation rate of V-51 in Ca1-xVYxO3 at least for x < 0.4 obeys the Korringa relation (T1T = constant), indicating the metallic electronic state at the V site.

TI OPTICAL-ABSORPTION IN CDTE DETECTED THROUGH CHANNEL CONDUCTION IN
   CDTE/INSB/CDTE SINGLE-QUANTUM-WELL GROWN BY MOLECULAR-BEAM EPITAXY
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE CDTE; QUANTUM WELL; PHOTOCURRENT; OPTICAL ABSORPTION; BAND GAP
ID FILMS
AB The measurement of the photocurrent in an undoped thin layer of CdTe is difficult because of its high resistivity. However, if carriers generated by optical absorption in the CdTe layer fall into a single quantum well, it is easy to determine the number of these carriers through the measurement of the channel current in the quantum well. By means of this method, well-width-independent absorption spectra of CdTe are obtained. The molecular beam epitaxy grown samples used have the following structure: CdTe/InSb/CdTe/GaAs. However, we could not specify the origin of the absorption peak occurring in the lower energy side of the band edge.

TI 1ST OBSERVATION OF THE SI(111)-7X7[--]1X1 PHASE-TRANSITION BY THE
   OPTICAL 2ND-HARMONIC GENERATION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SURFACE; 2ND HARMONIC GENERATION (SHG); TEMPERATURE DEPENDENCE; PHASE
   TRANSITION; SI(111); SI(111)-7X7; SI(111)-1X1
ID SURFACE RECONSTRUCTION; HIGH-TEMPERATURE; SI(111); SILICON; 7X7
AB Temperature dependence of the second harmonic generation of the Si(111)-7 x 7 surface was measure in the temperature range from 550-degrees-C to 1100-degrees-C. For the first time Si(111)-7 X 7 <-> 1 x 1 phase transition around 860-degrees-C was observed as an abrupt intensity change of the SH signal within 15 degrees using an optical technique. A hysteretic behavior with temperature difference of 2-degrees-C was observed in heating and cooling processes over the transition region. A gradual decrease of the SH intensity with temperature was also observed.

AU KOBAYASHI, K
   SUZUKI, T
   TSUKADA, M
AF KOBAYASHI, K
   SUZUKI, T
   TSUKADA, M
TI THEORY OF TIP SURFACE GAP DEPENDENCE IN LASER-ASSISTED SCANNING
   TUNNELING MICROSCOPY
SO SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID STM IMAGE; GRAPHITE; JUNCTION
AB Nonlinear characteristics of laser-assisted tunneling in the context of scanning tunneling microscopy (STM) are investigated by combining Bardeen's formalism and the WKB approximation. Atomic-scale images of the second-order nonlinear response calculated for graphite are dependent on the tip-sample distance. At small distance, this response is proportional to the square of the derivative of the surface local density of states (LDOS), giving trigonal images peaking atop A sites. However, at large distance. the images are proportional to the square of the LDOS, giving trigonal images of B sites. The Present formalism can also predict atomic-scale STM images induced by laser irradiating other surfaces such as silicon.
C1 INST PHYS & CHEM RES,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.
